title: 114_hr5480
content: The "Boosting Equity for the American Middle Class Act of 2016" or the "BEAM Act of 2016" introduces a refundable credit for early principal payments on certain home mortgages under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "BEAM Act of 2016" introduces a credit for excess home mortgage principal payments made by individuals, limited to 50% of the payments and capped at $500 annually. There is a lifetime limit of 10 years for claiming the credit, and a reduction based on modified adjusted gross income. Rules related to joint returns specify that married individuals must file jointly to claim a credit, and the credit is subject to a lifetime limitation when claimed on a joint return. The credit under subsection (a) can be claimed on a joint return with a spouse, and the credit is subject to a lifetime limitation when claimed jointly.
